actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill providing that certain foreign losses which were economically incurred before December 31, 1975, will not be subject to the loss recapture rules of the Tax Reform Act of 1976.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend for two years the time by which a corporation which has sustained substantial losses prior to January 1, 1976, and which has dismissed substantially all its employees before December 31, 1977, must liquidate in order to exempt a taxpayer who holds at least a ten percent interest in such corporation from the application of the foreign loss recapture rules enacted by the Tax Reform Act of 1976.

titles.title: A bill providing that certain foreign losses which were economically incurred before December 31, 1975, will not be subject to the loss recapture rules of the Tax Reform Act of 1976.
